brief_summary.textblock: Recent evidence has shown that young people that want to have children have low fertility knowledge. This study evaluates the efficacy of a video intervention on fertility knowledge, on changes in lifestyle and on the decision to start to get pregnant.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will compare the efficacy of a video intervention versus control (no video) in couples that intend to have children in the next three years. The couples will be randomized to the two groups. The video contains information concerning age-related fertility decline, fertility risk factors, the success of infertility treatments, and emotional consequences of childlessness.

primary_outcome.time_frame: T0 - before the intervention; T1 - one month later; T2 - six months later; T3 - one year later
primary_outcome.description: This measure assesses fertility knowledge by asking questions on the probability of conception and fertility treatment success rates, infertility definition and infertility risk factors

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in number of months planned to get pregnant/pregnancy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: T0 - before the intervention; T1 - one month later; T2 - six months later; T3 - one year later
secondary_outcome.description: This question measures the number of months estimated by participants until they get pregnant or pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intention and adoption of fertility-optimizing behaviors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: T0 - before the intervention; T1 - one month later; T2 - six months later; T3 - one year later
secondary_outcome.description: These questions assessed the intentions to adopt and the effective adoption of fertility-optimizing behaviors

arm_group.description: A five-minute video concerning age-related fertility decline, fertility risk factors, success of infertility treatments and emotional consequences of childlessness

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female member of the couples has between 24 to 40 years
- Childless couples trying to conceive or couples who desired to have children in the next 3 years
- Relationship length minimum of one year
Exclusion Criteria:
- Couples that already had achieved a successful pregnancy
- Couples with children

facility.name: University of Porto, Faculty of Psychology and Educational and Education Sciences
